div1.p: United States District Court Western District of Washington Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Suguira, alias B.K. Suguira, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. } No. 2504. Demurrer.

Comes now the respondent Joseph R. H. Jacoby, United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington, by his attorney C. F. Riddell, United States Attorney for said District, and demurs to the petition heretofore filed in the above entitled cause on the ground and for the reason that the same does not state facts sufficient to constitute a cause of action against this respondent, nor to entitle the petitioners to any relief whatsoever.
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Application of Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Suguira, alias B.K. Suguira, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Filed in the U.S. District Court Jul 7 1913 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk, by EML Deputy
Recieved a copy of the within demurrer this 7 day of July 1913 R.W. McClelland & W. Martin Attorneys for petitioners.
